אֲשֶׁר.text: The Hebrew word אֲשֶׁר can mean “that,” or “who.”

tokensOfLine.text: קִדְּשָׁנוּ בְּמִצְוֹתָיו, _Hashem asher kiddishanu b’mitzvosav, “Hashem who sanctified us with his commandments.”

tokens.text: אֲשֶׁר (b. h.  √אש, cmp. next w. ; v. Ges. H. Dict. s. v., as to opinions on etymol.) [being,] who, which. Ber. 11ᵇ א׳ בחר וכ׳ who hast chosen us; a. v. fr. (in prayer formulas).—In Talm. mostly prefix-שֶׁ.
